briefdescription.para: Level for debug messages.
Level for traces.
Level for information messages.
Level for warning messages.
Level for error messages.
Level for fatal error messages.
Verbosity levels of log messages.
Singleton class giving access to logging features.

detaileddescription.para: It supports custom domain, writing into a file as well as several verbosity levels. The LinphoneLoggingServiceCbs listener allows you to be notified each time a log is printed.
As the LinphoneLoggingService is a singleton, use linphone_logging_service_get() to get it.

briefdescription.para: Listener for LinphoneLoggingService.
Verbosity levels of log messages.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* LinphoneLoggingServiceCbsLogMessageWrittenCb) (LinphoneLoggingService *log_service, const char *domain, LinphoneLogLevel level, const char *message)
memberdef.argsstring: )(LinphoneLoggingService *log_service, const char *domain, LinphoneLogLevel level, const char *message)
memberdef.name: LinphoneLoggingServiceCbsLogMessageWrittenCb

briefdescription.para: Type of callbacks called each time liblinphone write a log message.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer on the logging service singleton.
A string describing which sub-library of liblinphone the message is coming from.

briefdescription.para: Gets the singleton logging service object.

detaileddescription.para: The singleton is automatically instantiated if it hasn't been done yet.

simplesect.para: A pointer on the LinphoneLoggingService singleton.

briefdescription.para: Increases the reference counter.
Decreases the reference counter and destroy the object if the counter reaches 0.
Adds a callback object to the list of listeners.
Removes a callback object from the list of listeners.
Returns the current callbacks being called while iterating on callbacks.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the current LinphoneLoggingServiceCbs object

briefdescription.para: Set the verbosity of the log.

detaileddescription.para:
For instance, a level of LinphoneLogLevelMessage will let pass fatal, error, warning and message-typed messages whereas trace and debug messages will be dumped out.
log_service
the LinphoneLoggingService object
level
the LinphoneLogLevel to set

briefdescription.para: Sets the types of messages that will be authorized to be written in the log.

parameterdescription.para: Example: LinphoneLogLevelMessage|LinphoneLogLevelError will ONLY let pass message-typed and error messages.

simplesect.para: Calling that function reset the log level that has been specified by linphone_logging_service_set_log_level().

briefdescription.para: Gets the log level mask.

memberdef.argsstring: (const LinphoneLoggingService *log_service, const char *dir, const char *filename, size_t max_size)
memberdef.name: linphone_logging_service_set_log_file

briefdescription.para: Enables logging in a file.

detaileddescription.para: That function enables an internal log handler that writes log messages in log-rotated files.

parameterdescription.para: Directory where to create the distinct parts of the log.
The maximal size of each part of the log. The log rotating is triggered each time the currently opened log part reach that limit.

briefdescription.para: Set the domain where application logs are written (for example with linphone_logging_service_message()).

simplesect.para: The domain is mandatory to write logs. This needs to be set before setting the log level.

briefdescription.para: Get the domain where application logs are written (for example with linphone_logging_service_message()).

simplesect.para: The domain where application logs are written.

briefdescription.para: Write a LinphoneLogLevelDebug message to the logs.
Write a LinphoneLogLevelTrace message to the logs.
Write a LinphoneLogLevelMessage message to the logs.
Write a LinphoneLogLevelWarning message to the logs.
Write a LinphoneLogLevelError message to the logs.
Write a LinphoneLogLevelFatal message to the logs.
Allow Linphone to set handlers for catching exceptions and write the stack trace into log.

detaileddescription.para:
Available for Windows. It keeps old handlers.
log_service
the LinphoneLoggingService object
enable
if TRUE global handlers will be prepend by the logger handlers. By default, it is FALSE.

briefdescription.para: Increases the reference counter.
Decreases the reference counter.

detaileddescription.para:
The object is automatically destroyed once the counter reach 0.
cbs
the LinphoneLoggingServiceCbs object.

briefdescription.para: Sets the callback to call each time liblinphone writes a log message.
Gets the value of the message event callback.
Pass a pointer on a custom object.

detaileddescription.para:
That pointer can be get back by callbacks by using #linphone_logging_service_get_cbs() and linphone_logging_service_cbs_get_user_data().
cbs
the LinphoneLoggingServiceCbs object.
user_data
the user data pointer.

briefdescription.para: Gets the user_data pointer back.
Gets the logging service listener.
Logging service of Linphone.
